intro: Tupa serrata, commonly known as the serrated tupa, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with serrated edges and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. Tupa serrata typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for both horticultural study and ecological research.
